intro: Lechea intermedia var. juniperina, commonly known as the Juniperina milkweed, is a species of flowering plant native to parts of Central America. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many plants with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically greenish-yellow, and it produces follicles that contain toxic seeds. This plant is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
